yanta is a noun meaning "bridge" or "yok: Image:Yanta.gifYanta is the name in Quenya of the thirty-fifth letter of the Tengwar alphabet.  In most modes it is used as a consonant and represents Y.
column5: as seen as in the inscription on the Doors of Durin of Moria
column6: Yanta represents E.  The Westron name for this letter is Ai.See Westron Tengwar

yanta is a noun meaning "bridge" or "yok: The word derives from the Primitive Quendian Sundocarme YAT.
